Question: A 36-year-old man falls on his outstretched right hand. Examination reveals tenderness in the anatomical snuffbox. Which of the following tendons forms a boundary of the anatomical snuffbox

A 26-year-old man presents to the ED with extensive bleeding from his arm after sustaining a glass injury. On examination there’s a 7 cm transverse laceration across the anterior aspect of his elbow. On exploring the cubital fossa, you expect the brachial artery to be:

An 80-year-old man dislocates his shoulder and got it reduced in the emergency department at review three weeks later, he’s unable to initiate abduction of his arm. Which muscle is most likely to be affected?

A 20-year old man presents to the emergency department with a stab injury to the thenar eminence . on examination, he is found to have a 2 cm long laceration with loss of sensation in the thumb and index finger and weakness of the thenar muscles. Which of the following structures is most likely to be injured?
Option 3: Sensory and motor branches of median nerve
Option 4: Sensory and motor branches of radial nerve
Option 5: sensory and motor branches of ulnar nerve
Correct Answer: Sensory and motor branches of median nerve

Question: in order to expose the right axillary artery, a transverse incision is typically made below the clavicle from a point just lateral to the sternal end of the clavicle to the deltopectoral groove. Which of the following structures would be encountered in the dissection down to the vessel?

A 4-year-old boy is brought to the emergency room with painful right elbow. His father states that he was swinging his son by his arms when the pain came on suddenly. An X-ray shows that the radial head is displaced from its usual position. What is the ligament of the proximal radioulnar joint that holds the radial head in place?

A 26-year-old man presents to the emergency department after sustaining a glass cut to his arm. On examination there’s a 10 cm longitudinal laceration on the anterior aspect of the upper arm. He has symptoms suggestive of ulnar nerve injury. On exploring the upper part of the arm. We would expect the ulnar nerve to be:
Option 1: Anterior then medial to the brachial artery
Option 2: Medial then anterior to the brachial artery
Option 4: Posterior then medial to the brachial artery

Question: a 19-year-old woman presents to the emergency department profoundly hypovolemic having fallen from a horse. A postero-anterior chest radiograph shows fracture to the medial third of the left clavicle. Which of the following vessels is most likely to be damaged?

A 20-year-old man presents to the emergency department after accidentally tripping over and leacerating his hand on a glass bottle. On examination there’s a 2 cm laceration on the hypothenar eminence with loss of flexion in the distal interphalangeal joint of the little finger what is the most likely tendon to be injured?
After the mastectomy the woman has winging of the scapula, what is the nerve being injured?

A 50-year-old alcoholic man presents to the emergency room and is found to be unable to extend his wrist, thumb and fingers of his right hand, he is also found to have weak extension of his right elbow and loss of sensation on the dorsum of the first web space. Which nerve is most likely to have been injured

A 36-year-old butcher injures his left index finger with a knife, suffering a deep laceration on the palmer aspect of the thumb on examination, he is unable to flex DIP of the thumb, which tendon is likely to have been injured?
A 58-year-old man is due to have surgery for dupuytrens contracture to release the ring finger of the right hand. Which of the following regarding the anatomy of the ring finger is correct?
Option 1: Has a cutaneous innervation form the radial nerve
Option 2: Has no cutaneous innervation from the median nerve
Option 3: Has no cutaneous innervation from the ulnar nerve
Option 4: Has the flexor digitorum profundus inserting into the middle phlanx
Option 5: Is abducted by a palmer interosseus muscle
Correct Answer: Has a cutaneous innervation form the radial nerve

Question: A patient presents to the clinic following a surgical procedure. She complains that she is unable to shrug her shoulder. What is the most likely underlying nerve injury?
A 33-year-old man sustains an injury to his forearm and wrist. When examined in clinic he is unable to adduct his thumb. What is the most likely underlying nerve lesion?
Option 2: Superficial branch of the ulnar nerve
Option 5: Deep branch of the ulnar nerve
Correct Answer: Deep branch of the ulnar nerve

Question: What is the nerve supply of the dorsal interossei of the fourth finger?

A 23-year-old patient was admitted to after falling of his outstretched hand. His examination revealed that he has lost sensation over the palmer aspect of the index and middle finger. What is the most likely cause of this injury?
What is the dermatome of the little finger?
What is the relation of ulnar nerve to the ulnar artery in the wrist?
Option 1: ulnar nerve is ulnar to the ulnar artery
Option 2: ulnar artery is ulnar to the ulnar nerve
Option 3: ulnar nerve is radial to the ulnar artery
Option 4: ulnar nerve is superficial to the ulnar artery
Correct Answer: ulnar nerve is ulnar to the ulnar artery

Question: froment test is used for testing which of the following muscles?

What is the nerve supply to the lateral side of the forearm?
What is the course of median nerve related to the brachial artery throughout the arm?
A patient suffered an injury extending from deltopectoral groove medially, which structure will not be affected?
A patient had upper limb injury. During examination, sensation over the dorsal aspect of the medial hand was intact with prominent claw hand what is the level of nerve injury?
Option 1: Radial nerve injury at the axilla
Option 2: Ulnar nerve injury at the wrist
Option 3: Median nerve injury at the cubital fossa
Option 4: Ulnar nerve injury at the elbow
Correct Answer: Ulnar nerve injury at the wrist

Question: A patient was undergoing radial head surgery for a fracture. Postoperatively, there is lost fingers extension with intact sensation. What is the nerve most likely to be injured?
Option 4: Superficial branch of radial nerve injury

Question: A patient suffered a cut injury in the front of elbow joint. Which most lateral structure to be injured at this site?
A patient has weakness of the elbow extension with lost sensation over 1st digit dorsum which nerve involved?
Option 4: Superficial branch of radial nerve injury

Question: A 32-year-old man suffered an injury to his palm resulting in loss sensation over hypothenar eminence, medial 1 and half finger, which nerve is involved?
The arterial blood supply to the scaphoid bone enters it from which end?
A patient had injury at wrist. Upon examination, hand was placed on the table with palm up, the patient can’t make his thumb 90 degrees on the hand. Which muscle is involved?
What is the dermatomal supply to the elbow, lateral forearm and thumb?
A 32-year-old patient presented with prominent claw hand with lost sensation over the medial arm. What is the spinal dermatome mostly affected?
A man suffered a cut injury above the olecranon process cause loss of ability to extend elbow. Sensation is intact. What is the structure being affected?

A man suffered a deep injury just near olecranon with no elbow or wrist extension, with loss of sensation over the cleft between the thumb and index finger dorsally. What is the structure being damaged?
A 35-year old patient has a wrist injury, and then developed thenar atrophy, what is the most likely affected nerve?
What is the spinal center for arm supination?
A patient can’t lift his thumb off the table while palm is facing downwards. Which is the most likely responsible nerve lesion?

A patient was undergoing surgical release of dupuytren’s contracture at the ring finger while a nerve was injured just lateral to the deep flexor tendons of the ring finger. What is the nerve affected at this site?

A 2 day old neonate is brought by his mother with an upper limb deformity. On examination, his right arm is adducted while his forearm is extended and pronated, which of the following nerves is expected to be intact?
A 12 year old boy suffered a supracondylar humeral fracture. Which nerve is at greatest risk?
A patient developed ptosis and loss of sensation over the medial side of the arm after a shoulder injury. What is the responsible nerve root?

A 24 years old man suffered an injury to his upper limb. On examination, his ring and little fingers are partially flexed with intact sensation over the dorsal aspect of these fingers. What is the most likely lesion?
a surgeon made an incision from below the clavicle to the deltopectoral groove. Which of the following structures will not be encountered?
A woman suffered an arm injury. On examination she is unable to catch the knife as her hand moves into flexion. There is loss of sensation over the badge area. What is the likely cause?
A patient has developed weakness in the intrinsic hand muscles with loss of sensation over the inner aspect of the arm. What is the most likely cause ?
Option 1: Ulnar nerve injury at the elbow
Option 3: Ulnar nerve injury at the wrist

Question: A 24-year-old man suffered an injury to the ulnar nerve during a fight. Which of the following thumb movement will be affected?
A 32 year old man sustained an elbow trauma during his work. His examination revealed severe pain on extremes of pronation and supination. What is the most likely injured nerve?
A patient presented with crutch related to the axilla , he has numbness over the lateral aspect of the forearm, which muscle will be affected as well?
Nerve injury following shoulder dislocation, deltoid is affected, which other muscle will be affected?
What is the relation of extensor indices to extensor digitorum in index finger?

A 12 year old child presented after a trauma to his wrist . Xray is normal and he was discharged. He is now presenting back after one week with severe pain at anatomical snuffbox. What is the likely diagnosis?
A patient cannot hold a piece of paper between thumb and index fingers without flexion. The described deformity is a result of injury of which nerve?
A 25 year old rugby player suffered fracture of medial epicondyle during a game. Which of the following muscles will not be affected?

Following a thoracotomy, a patient complains of numbness and loss of fine control of the left hand. On examination, it is established that the numbness is on the ulnar border of the hand and involves the little finger and both sides of the ring finger. The hand is weak including both the abductor pollicis brevis and the first dorsal interossei muscle. Which of the following is the most likely site of neurological injury?
Option 1: Lower trunk of the brachial plexus
Option 3: Middle trunk of the brachial plexus
Option 5: Upper trunk of the brachial plexus
Correct Answer: Lower trunk of the brachial plexus

Question: A 21 year old patient was stabbed in his upper forearm, on examination, while his palm is on the table, he can’t lift his thumb off the table. On examination of proximal phalanges of the thumb, the patient cannot still fully move his interphalangeal joint. What is the expected cause?

A 26-year old patient sustained an upper limb trauma resulting in a comminuted proximal forearm fracture. On examination, he can’t flex his elbow and there is  altered sensation on the lateral aspect of the forearm. Which nerve root is responsible for the lesion?

A 29 year old patient fell from his motorbike. He is fully conscious and alert but appears to be in remarkably increasing pain. On examination , he can’t flex his elbow joint with altered sensation on the lateral side of the right arm. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Option 3: Dislocated elbow with ulnar nerve damage
Option 4: Fracture of the surgical neck of the humerus
Option 5: Supracondylar fracture of the humerus with median nerve damage

Question: A 12 years old child suffered a glass injury just proximal to the distal palmer crease. On examination, there is loss of proximal joint flexion of the thumb. What is the expected associated lesion?
Option 1: Loss of sensation over the whole palmer aspect of the hand
Option 2: Loss of sensation over the medial one and half fingers
Option 3: Loss of sensation over the dorsal aspect of the lateral three and half fingers
Option 4: Loss of sensation over the palmer aspect of the thumb and lateral two and half fingers
Option 5: Loss of sensation over the whole dorsal aspect of the hand
Correct Answer: Loss of sensation over the palmer aspect of the thumb and lateral two and half fingers

Question: A 22 year old patient presented with a laceration over the volar aspect of the wrist. He is scheduled for exploration of the wound. What is the likely relation of ulnar artery at the wrist?
a 46 year old patient presented with parathesia on the medial side of the arm. His investigations revealed presence of a pancost tumor. What is the expected root compression?

A 52 year old female is in the postoperative clinic after right mastectomy. She complains of weak right hand grasp as she cannot lift her suitcase, but she can write by thumb and index. What is the expected nerve injury?

A 23 year old male presented after a surgical procedure shown in the picture. He complains of sensory loss over the palmer aspect of the thenar eminence, thumb and index with thenar muscle wasting. What is the most accepted cause of this presentation?
Option 1: Median nerve injury proximal to the flexor crease
Option 2: Median nerve injury distal to the flexor crease
Correct Answer: Median nerve injury proximal to the flexor crease

Question: Which structure forms the lower border of the quadrangular scapular space?
A 62 year old patient presented with a lateral forearm sensory loss after an RTA. Which muscle action is expected to be affected ?

A 12 years old boy falls on his outstretched hand while riding his bike. On examination he has tenderness in the floor of the anatomical snuffbox. Xray confirmed a displaced scaphoid fracture, and the orthopedic surgeon decides that it needs surgical fixation. Regarding the anatomy of the scaphoid bone, which part of this bone is at risk of avascular necrosis?
What is the exact type of the 1st carpometacarpal joint of the hand
A patient sustained a motor bike accident during a marathon. Which of the following would indicate a proximal lesion with the poorest prognosis?
Option 3: Loss of sensation over the dorsum of the hand

Question: A 33 years old athlete sustained a stab injury causing a laceration 2 cm proximal to flexor retinaculum presented with parathesia over the lateral palmer three and half fingers and over the thenar eminence. On motor assessment, he has a restricted thumb movements with weak wrist flexion and abducition. Which of the following the most likely responsible injury?
Option 3: Median nerve & recurrent branch of median
Option 4: Median nerve & flexor carpi radialis tendon
Option 5: Abductor pollicis muscle & flexor pollicis muscle
Correct Answer: Median nerve & flexor carpi radialis tendon

Question: A 32 year old man sustained an upper limb trauma. On examination, he has mild claw hand of the little and ring fingers with loss of sensation over the medial 1/3 if the hand. Which of the following the most likely responsible injury?

A 32 year old man sustained an upper limb trauma. On examination, he has lost medial sensation at the forearm. Which of the following the most likely responsible injury?

A 21 year old patient sustained a radial fracture during a fight. On examination, while his palm is on the table, he can’t lift his thumb off the table. On fixing of proximal phalanges of the thumb, the patient cannot move his interphalangeal joint. What is the accepted cause?

A 32 year old patient presented to emergency department after a fall. Upon examination, he is unable to internally rotate and adduct his shoulder. Which rotator cuff muscle is responsible for internal rotation of the shoulder?
A 43 year old patient presented with positive tinel’s sign. He reported hand pain at night along the palmer aspect of the index and middle fingers. Which muscle is expected to be preserved?

A surgeon is due to perform a mid-humeral shaft fracture fixation while he found a nerve passing posterior then lateral to the humeus. The nerve then passes anteriorly at the lateral condyle. What is the expected descriped nerve?
Which tendon lies in the third compartment of extensor retinaculum?

A 43 year old sportsman is brought by ambulance post traumatic. On examination , his vital signs are normal while he cannot abduct his shoulder. Sensory testing denotes parathesia over the lateral aspect of the arm and forearm. Which nerve is most likely to be involved?

A 2 year old child is assessed after lung surgery. His sensory examination is unremarkable, but he is unable to push himself from crawling to standing position due to right arm weakness. Which of the following structures would be injured?
Radial nerve course is mainly posterior all through its course. At which anatomical spot of the following does the radial nerve travel from posterior group to anterior group?
Option 4: 1 cm above the insertion of biceps

Question: An 80 year old man dislocates his shoulder and got it reduced in the emergency department at review three weeks later, he is unable to initiate abduction of his arm, which nerve is most likely to be injured?

A 43 year old patient presented with positive tinel’s sign. He reported hand pain at night along the palmar aspect of the index and middle fingers. Which muscle is expected to be preserved?
Following a supraclavicular LN dissection a 43 year old male patient is unable to shrug his left shoulder. Which of the following deformities would be expected?
Option 2: Inability to rotate the face towards the right side
Option 3: Inability to rotate the face towards the left side
Option 4: Loss of sensation over the upper lateral shoulder
Option 5: Inability to shrug the other shoulder
Correct Answer: Inability to rotate the face towards the right side
